murder.punishment: Death penalty or life imprisonment and fine
murder.description: Intentional and unlawful killing of a person with clear intention or knowledge.

attempt to murder.punishment: Up to 10 years imprisonment or life imprisonment and fine
attempt to murder.description: An act done with intention to cause death but the victim survives.

culpable homicide.punishment: Life imprisonment or up to 10 years and fine
culpable homicide.description: Causing death without full intention to commit murder.

hurt.punishment: Up to 1 year imprisonment or fine or both
hurt.description: Causing simple physical injury to another person.

grievous hurt.punishment: Up to 7 years imprisonment and fine
grievous hurt.description: Causing serious injury like fracture, permanent damage or loss of limb.

kidnapping.punishment: Up to 7 years imprisonment and fine
kidnapping.description: Taking a minor or person away without lawful consent.

abduction.punishment: Punishment depends on purpose of abduction
abduction.description: Forcibly taking or compelling a person to move from one place to another.

rape.description: Sexual intercourse without free and voluntary consent.

sexual harassment.punishment: Up to 3 years imprisonment or fine or both
sexual harassment.description: Unwelcome sexual advances, demands or inappropriate physical contact.

stalking.punishment: Up to 3 years (first offence), 5 years (subsequent offence)
stalking.description: Repeatedly following or contacting a person against their will.

dowry death.description: Death of a married woman due to dowry-related harassment.

domestic violence.section: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005
domestic violence.punishment: Protection order, fine or imprisonment (breach may lead to jail up to 1 year)
domestic violence.description: Physical, emotional, verbal or economic abuse within domestic relationship.

theft.punishment: Up to 3 years imprisonment or fine or both
theft.description: Dishonestly taking movable property without permission.

robbery.punishment: Up to 10 years imprisonment and fine
robbery.description: Taking property using force, threat or violence.

dacoity.punishment: Life imprisonment or up to 10 years and fine
dacoity.description: Robbery committed by five or more persons.

cheating.punishment: Up to 7 years imprisonment and fine
cheating.description: Dishonest deception to obtain property or money.

criminal breach of trust.punishment: Up to 3 years imprisonment or fine or both
criminal breach of trust.description: Misusing property entrusted to a person.

forgery.punishment: Up to 2 years imprisonment or fine or both

defamation.punishment: Up to 2 years imprisonment or fine or both
defamation.description: Harming a person's reputation through false statements.

rioting.punishment: Up to 2 years imprisonment or fine or both
rioting.description: Use of violence by an unlawful assembly.

unlawful assembly.punishment: Up to 6 months imprisonment or fine or both
unlawful assembly.description: Assembly of five or more persons with illegal objective.

public nuisance.description: Act causing inconvenience, danger or injury to the public.

corruption.punishment: Up to 7 years imprisonment and fine
corruption.description: Public servant taking bribe or abusing official position.

hacking.punishment: Up to 3 years imprisonment or fine or both
hacking.description: Unauthorized access or damage to computer systems.

cyber fraud.punishment: Up to 3 years imprisonment and fine
cyber fraud.description: Cheating through online means or digital platforms.

identity theft.punishment: Up to 3 years imprisonment and fine
identity theft.description: Fraudulent use of another person's digital identity.

drug trafficking.punishment: 10 to 20 years imprisonment and heavy fine
drug trafficking.description: Illegal production, sale or transport of narcotic drugs.

acid attack.punishment: Minimum 10 years to life imprisonment and fine
acid attack.description: Causing permanent damage or disfigurement by throwing acid.

human trafficking.punishment: 7 years to life imprisonment and fine
human trafficking.description: Exploitation of persons through force, fraud or coercion.
